result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin M Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the $1,000.00 cash bond be applied to the fine and costs.  Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
-No Contact with any known drug dealers or users.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
8:37 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sanders-Brown has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Atty Sanders-Brown makes statement regarding receipt of the PSI.  Statement by the Court.  Defendant requests to proceed.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Statement by Bob Dohr.  Statement by Kella Anderson.  Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Sentencing statement by Atty Sanders-Brown.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CF31

1 year of Initial Confinement and 1 year of Extended Supervision.
AODA and any follow-up.
D.L. revocation - 4 years
IID - 4 years

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-$1200 fine plus court costs
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
-No Contact with any known drug dealers or users.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

2014CF138

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs
-Restitution of $853.68
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
-No Contact with any known drug dealers or users.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

2014CF115

4 years IC and 3 years ES consecutive to any other sentence

CONDITIONS:

- Court costs
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
-No Contact with any known drug dealers or users.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Sentence is to commence immediately and remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Dept.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP and SAP Program.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit as confirmed by the jail.

Court orders the cash bonds on file be applied to the restitution, fine and costs.

Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court adjourned at 8:59 a.m.
to counsel with a copy of the presentence investigation report
to Agent Michael Pulice - Court grants the request.  PSI is to be file on or before 10/02/2015.
from Agent Michael Pulice - requests a 4 day extension to file the PSI.  Approved, PSI to be filed on or before 10/02/2015.
Sentencing hearing at 10-12-2015 08:30 am

2:10 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Sanders-Brown, defendant will plea to count 1 in 2014CF115, count 1 in 2015CF31 and count 1 in 2014CF138 and the balance of the counts/cases will be dismissed and read-in, with the State requesting a pre-sentence investigation report.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 of 2014CF115, count 1 on 2015CF31 and count 1 on 2014CF138.  Court strikes the place enhancer on count 1 of 2014CF115 and orders the balance of the counts/cases be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a Presentence investigation report be completed and filed with the court in 60 days.  Court sets for Sentencing on October 12, 2015 ar 8:30 a.m. Statement by DA Christenson - requests the defendant be remanded to the custody of the Green Lake County Jail.  Court revokes bond and remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Dept.

Court adjourned at 2:21 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-28-2015 02:00 pm
Defendant's
By Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown

Statement by Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown - in regards to 15CF43 & 15CF54, defendant will be waiving the prelims on those cases and has requested a global resolution all cases including a Marquette County case.  Court will schedule all cases for Plea & Sentencing on July 21, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court will set for status hearing on June 1, 2015 at 9:30 a.m .

1:39 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  No objection to hold a courtesy appearance.  No objection by defendant.  Atty Kristina Sanders-Brown confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs regarding DNA and expungement.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  NO Contact with Officer Prachel or any members of his family.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits. 

Atty Sanders-Brown requests all cases be set for status hearing.  
Court sets all cases for status hearing on May 11, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.

2015CF31 - Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.  State files an information with the court.  Attorney Sanders-Brown and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Sanders-Brown enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Court sets all cases for Plea & Sentencing on April 7, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.
